strings.string: Change your digital satellite receiver settings
Setup your digital satellite receiver including antenna, channel search, update, etc
Display the programme information of each channel in time and date order
Edit TV/radio channel list and sort them in the numerical or alphabetic order
Manage and view your multimedia content in one place
Display device information including system versions, free disk space, etc
Learn how to get the most out of PRISMCUBE RUBY
Get current weather and weather forecast for thousands of cities around the world
Access your picture collection and view them as a slideshow with transition effects
Playback videos from the beginning or resume viewing from the moment you stopped
Browse through your source folders and play music files
Run your installed add-ons which enhance the features and functions of XBMC
Configure the general settings of XBMC
Handle your multimedia files in an easy and efficient way
Display detailed information about your system status
Check your PRISMCUBE RUBY info at a glance
To see all the other menus, press i button
Access your favorite XBMC add-ons in a convenient way
Follow five simple steps for getting your PRISMCUBE RUBY ready for use
Select cable connection type and configure the DiSEqC settings of tuner 1 or tuner 2
Perform a quick and easy automatic channel scan or search channels manually
Add new transponders or edit the transponders already exist
Configure the general settings for your digital satellite receiver
Setup Smartcard or CI-Module configuration for watching pay channels
Get the latest updates on your PRISMCUBE RUBY

When set to 'On', new channels are searched from existing transponders and the additional transponders that stored by transponder network however if you set this option to 'Off', only the transponder you selected will be searched

When set to 'Automatic', the time and date will be obtained automatically from the channel that you select

Set the time zone that will be the basis for the date and time display

Press the OK button to save time settings

Press the OK button to remove everything in the recording partition

Go to First Installation after restoring system to the factory default

When set to 'Same with Tuner 1', both tuners are connected to the same signal source

Select the satellite on which the transponder you wish to scan is located

When set to 'Off', only the factory default transponders of the satellites you previously selected will be scanned for new channels. If you set to 'On', both the existing transponders and additional transponders that have not yet been stored to be located are scanned for new channels
